review_content: Short Description: A Witbier that's well balanced between is fruity and herbal flavours, but with malts that taste bland and heavy. .::. Pours a very cloudy yellow with greenish edges, and with a large white head that doesn't last for long. Aroma is very fresh and citric, with prominent notes of lemon, orange, and herbs. When it comes to flavour, the orange does not overpower the coriander. This is very well balanced, in a classic witbier style. However, the malts in here have a different flavour from what one would expect in a Witbier. The corn weakens the breadiness of the wheat and barley malts, leaving the final malt flavours closer to a pale ale than to a wheat beer, despite the mouth-feel being way more dense and the beer still feeling as carb heavy as a german Weiss. The after-taste is herbal and fruity, leaving no sourness behind. Despite is fruitiness, this beer fails to be either refreshing or bready, likely due to the corn diluting the flavour but still leaving it carb heavy.
Aromat sztuczna pomarancza teoche estrow i kolendra mdla. lekkosc i pijalnosc ratuje to piwo. jak na koncern ok

Bottle in a restaurant at Oberá, Argentina. Pours hazy straw yellow with a little white head. The aroma features strong citrusy fruitiness - with especially lemon apparent - with a touch of wheat and coriander. Taste offers citrusy fruitiness with wheaty maltiness and a faint touch of spiciness. Strong fruity flavours but also wheaty maltiness pushes through. Very fresh. The mouthfeel is perhaps the weakest part here, as it is light-bodied and thin with average to lively carbonation. Quite decent, very easily drinkable wit.
Weak wheat flavor, expected more , thin texture and not much head, but drinkable and enjoyable
Aromat jakiś taki zgniły, nie czuć w ogóle dodatków, zero charakteru witbiera. Smak bardzo płytki, wodnisty, nie czuć dodatków, do tego nieprzyjemna goryczka. Słabe

Pouring a bright tropical-orange colour with a deep haze you could get lost in, this Witbier glows in the sunlight. The head is quite small for a Witbier, but that is down to the bartenders pour; it has an off-white colour. This beer is a fairly tropical one, mainly thanks to the strong additions of pineapple which are fairly evident in both the aroma and flavour. Other aromatic qualities include spice, coriander, orange peel and lemon. The taste is similar to a tropical fruit squash with the taste of lemon and pineapple being the most apparent fruits. The herbs and spices are far more subtle due to the big fruity flavour, not to mention the sour, acidic finish that is provided by the yeast. There is a medium carbonation and medium body on what is quite a light drink with a low bitterness. This is an ideal drink for beginners who are wanting to start exploring the craft beer scene, but will most likely not hit the spot for lovers of the style.

Read the full review here:

www.beerwithus1.wordpress.com/2019/06/08/patagonia-brewery
Decepcionante sabor, a la vista va bien. Es superada ampliamente por cervezas weisse industriales.
Big can in a random coffee shop in Piriapolis. Medium hazy weizen appearance with no head. Scent is fairly clear cumin. Taste is mild Belgian style saison with peppery notes. Too cold.

0,355l bottle, courtesy of Karol, many friends, Pours deep cloudy straw pale to yellow liquid, medium creamy white head, Aroma: spicy, lot of cloves, coriander, wheat, lemon peel, slightly banana, Taste: light to medium sweet, light bitter, light to medium sour, quite spicy, clove, coriander, wheat, lemon peel, Palate: light body, soft to average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, long spicy aftertaste, Overall: not so bad, but neither very good.
Cerveja muito frutada, notas de limão, notas de abacaxi, leve sabor de coentro que confere muita personalidade a esta cerveja. Muito refrescante.

4/1/2019. Can from Supermercado Liu Heshuang, Bolívar, Buenos Aires. Pours cloudy pale orange gold with a short lasting white head. Aroma of melon, lemon squash, banana, clove, coriander and yeast. Medium plus sweetness, light bitterness and tartness. Moderate body, average carbonation. Light citrus acidity to finish. Not bad but not special either.

Brazilian version. 
Bottle in Itaim, SP, 8R$ or so. pale color very cloudy, persistent white head. Aroma of spices (lavender, coriander), orange, wheat. Fluffy texture with sustained carbonation, mild juicy and sugary, some grass in the mix. A bit funky but refreshing after all.
Color mas cristalino q las weiss alemanas, demasiado suave en cuanto al sabor a trigo

It's very similar to belgian beer Hoegaarden, same style (this is not a German Hefe but a Witbier) as we can clearly distinguish orange, coriander and banana aroma. Body is medium and it's really a refreshing beer. Nothing to envy to the great witbier beer Hoegaarden

Birra grossolana e di bassa qualità ma comunque un must in Argentina e bevereccia!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Weak wheat flavor, expected more , thin texture and not much head, but drinkable and enjoyable

Cerveja leve e bem refrescante, de aroma e sabor com notas de laranja, muito pr�xima de uma witbier.

Fresca y de muy buen sabor ... recomendable ! Con toques cítricos excelente para mariscos 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Excelent beer. Combination of wheat with aroma and extrair of orange and coriander. Malts of barley and wheat. Unmalted cereals and hops.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 0.33l. Pours hazy deep straw color with thin creamy white head and average sparkling appearance. Aroma of citrus, wheat, coriander and bubblegum. Tastes refreshing grainy, citric and spicy with very mild bitter finish. Light body, thin texture and soft to average carbonation in palate. Very drinkable and a bit under carbonated...

Al destaparla, se puede sentir el aroma a plátano, casi distintivo de las de trigo. En el vaso, ya pude apreciar un color pajizo pálido, bastante turbio, con sedimento en botella. A mi parecer demasiado clara. Lo segundo: la espuma. Carbinatacion baja, lo cual habla de que no usaron la cantidad tradicional de trigo sino qun un poco menos y seguramente otros cereales. Sabor, regular. Pude sentir el sabor frutal. Pero para mi, le faltó complejidad. Ni cerca de una Hefeweissen bien hecha.
Bottle, 740 ml, courtesy of JFK10000, shared with him and Miro. Pours murky yellow, average creamy white head. Malty, fruity, citrus, some spices. Light to moderate sweetness. Light to medium body.

Pours a hazy yellow golden color, topped with a medium and non-lasting white head. Wheaty nose with banana coming out, some other fruity notes as well. Slightly sweet with some mild spicy presence. A bit of bitterness and slight soury touch. Fruity feel. Light and sparkly.
Bottle from Ascuncion Gas Station. Hazy golden body with medium white head. Nose is citrus, hops, lemonpeel. Taste is lemon and hops and spices. Creamy texture with citrus in the finish.

[ bottle ][ 1.5oz ][ @Tasting ][ $? ][ mini snifter ][ 05.01.16 ]
 
hazy straw, thin white head dies fast, tepid after. Cidery wheat/cinammon nose. Front palate is thin, low carbonation. Plenty of lemon with light cinammon building mid-palate, maybe pumpernickel. Finishing low carbed and slick, slightly hot medicinal.

drunk from the bottle while in Argentinian Patagonia, very lovely beer especially compared to the other swill produced in Latin America.
Banana and bubblegum, some citrusy orange, one of the best beers I had in my 3 months in South America, not sure why this is so lowly rated. Goddamn beer snobs or my taste buds deteriorated immensely from all the Quilmes aha
Boa cerveja weiss. Leve e suave palato de cerveja weiss. Bom aroma e aparencia. Nota final 3.0
Bottle at the DC RateBeer Tasting. Very hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of cardboard, light citrus. Tastes of cardboard, light citrus, corn, wheat. Light body with a dry finish.

Bottle pour at the May 1st DC Tasting. Poured a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Aroma was light coriander notes, light herbal character. Light sweet notes, hay. Was more pleasant than I expected.

12oz bottle I picked up at a supermarket in Lima, pours a hazy gold with some frothy, white head. Nose is OK, lots of spices, some tomato, a little grass. Flavor is not good, bananas, tomatos, spice, yeast. Slick finish.
Bottle. Cloudy straw color. Aroma of light lemon. Taste has lemon, not much else. Boring.
From a bottle at the DC gathering May 1, 2016. Pours a cloudy pale gold with an off white head. Light lemon aroma. Flavors of wheat toast. Crisp finish.

12oz bottle. Small white head atop murky apple cider body. Aroma is moderately sweet, spicy, some lemon/banana, clove. Taste is moderately sweet, orange, some banana, light spicy. Light-medium body, light effervescence.

It is not the best weissbier, it is not like some Bavarians brewery. The color is a nice creamy, yellow color, thin foam and low carbonation but it is normal, once again watery but there is a discreet touch with the wheat, giving a nice touch of banana, drinkable.

The beer has a acceptable look. There are some weissen aspects. The beer is very cloudy and has a yellow color. The beer is a bit pale for a weissen beer, if you ask me. It isn’t totally weissen. The beer forms a decent layer of very rough foam, of which the bulk collapses. A minimal drape of foam remains on top of the foam. The smell is mild and watery. There is a minimal amount of citrus fruit and coriander, but it is very mild. There is an unpleasant maybe soap like aroma to it, which isn’t really great. The taste is appreciable. The beer had a little weisen taste, but it misses the strong citrus fruits. It is again watery, just like the smell and has a soap flavor. It isn’t my cup of tee. It reminds me of Edelweiss beer, of which I wasn’t a big fan as well. Not bad but definitely not good.

Amarillo ocre con opacidad, espuma media con retención. Lúpulo cítrico moderado, malta trigo bajo, acidez cítrica, ésteres a limón. En boca malta de trigo moderado bajo, lúpulo cítrico bajo, ligera acidez, lúpulo de amargor nulo. Final fresco a trigo, con cuerpo bajo, buena carbonatación.
Levemente ácida, aroma carregado e corpo muito bom para uma Weiss. No geral é superior às outras Weiss.

Boa weiss. Uma mistura marcante com laranja e coentro. Apesar de haver equilíbrio, o aroma e sabor da laranja são bem notados. Levemente adocicado. Uma cerveja de trigo diferente para quem gosta de apreciar.

Líquido turvo,coloração palha,espuma fina com média duração;no aroma e no sabor frutas cítricas,coentro,malte e fermento,baixo corpo,alta carbonatação,final adocicado,retrogosto com leve acidez,refrescante,boa "drinkability". Wit com bom padrão,vale a experiência.
Buena cerveza de trigo. Turbia,con olor a banana clavo de olor y citricos. La contra es el precio, muy caro para esta cerveza
The aroma was like someone spilled ketchup on a hefeweizen , and the taste literally almost made me puke. I can’t believe they sell this..
